Nicki Green: Firmament-Contemporary Jewi.description: Transdisciplinary artist Nicki Green’s first museum solo exhibition delves into questions of identity, transformation, and reinvention of Jewish traditions through new and existing artworks in ceramic, installation, fiber, and more. Inspired by the concept of the firmament—a dividing form referenced in the Torah that separated the earth from the heavens—Green reimagines the gallery space as an environment of welcome and liberation centering trans and nonbinary bodies. Artworks rendered primarily in clay feature motifs that invoke fermentation, mycelium, and reinvented ritual as metaphors for regeneration, transformation, and resilience—concepts that have informed Jewish thinking and practice for thousands of years. By reclaiming parts of her Jewish upbringing, reinventing functional forms of ceramic objects, and reimagining ways of embracing different genders and sexualities, Green challenges and expands the binary limits of our society.

Looted-Contemporary Jewish Museum.name: Looted
Looted-Contemporary Jewish Museum.description: Uncovering powerful insights into the relationships between art, memory, politics, and loss, this multimedia installation reflects on the history of Polish-owned paintings stolen during the Nazi occupation in World War II. Initiated by Polish artist Dorota Mytych and created with painting collaborators Tracy Grubbs (San Francisco), Jessica Houston (Canada), and Marcia Teusink (UK), the installation features the four artists jointly recreating a total of fifty-nine looted artworks based on documentation from the Polish government catalogue of wartime losses. Watching this mesmerizing process comes with an unexpected conclusion: before each canvas can dry, the artists wipe away their own painstaking work in a stunning erasure that challenges the meaning of authorship, ownership, and recovery. Paintings by Raphael, Rembrandt van Rijn, Peter Paul Rubens, and others are infinitely recreated and erased, offering new ways to process the impact of these stolen works and experience art as a means for resilience.

Ruth Asawa: Untitled (S.272)-Asian Art M.description: A chance to intimately encounter one of Ruth Asawa’s most celebrated works.

East West Bank Art Terrace-Asian Art Mus.name: East West Bank Art Terrace
East West Bank Art Terrace-Asian Art Mus.description: The East West Bank Art Terrace is an outdoor platform for contemporary art featuring thought-provoking works by both emerging and world-renowned artists.

Taihu Rock\u2014East Wind II-Asian Art M.name: Taihu Rock—East Wind II
Taihu Rock\u2014East Wind II-Asian Art M.description:
What happens when a calligrapher exchanges ink for metal? Find out with artist Tianjin Ren's 
Taihu Rock—East Wind II
, now anchoring Osher Plaza in front of the museum’s main entrance on Larkin Street.

Community Feast-Asian Art Museum.name: Community Feast
Community Feast-Asian Art Museum.description: A local artist honors the Asian American experience while celebrating the ways that food unites us all.

Ashwini Bhat: What Will It Take / For Us.name: Ashwini Bhat: What Will It Take / For Us To Awake?
Ashwini Bhat: What Will It Take / For Us.description: “Just as the act of ringing the bell in a temple is believed to induce mindfulness, this calla lily bell metaphorically suggests a wake-up call, focusing attention on our climate and ecological emergency.” –Ashwini Bhat

Mayumi Oda-Asian Art Museum.name: Mayumi Oda
Mayumi Oda-Asian Art Museum.description: Prints by Mayumi Oda honor goddesses with lively compositions, vivid colors, and bold outlines.

Selections from the Guru Nanak Janamsakh.name: Selections from the Guru Nanak Janamsakhi
Selections from the Guru Nanak Janamsakh.description: Take a thoughtful journey with the founder and first guru of Sikhism.

Southeast Asian Galleries-Asian Art Muse.name: Southeast Asian Galleries
Southeast Asian Galleries-Asian Art Muse.description: Now on view: a new cast of colorful puppets and a range of betel containers from Vietnam, Indonesia, and the Philippines.

Hallyu! The Korean Wave-Asian Art Museum.name: Hallyu! The Korean Wave
Hallyu! The Korean Wave-Asian Art Museum.description:

can’t
 get enough K-pop, Korean dramas, and 
kimbap
.

Mountains of the Mind: A Chinese Landsca.name: Mountains of the Mind: A Chinese Landscape Journey
Mountains of the Mind: A Chinese Landsca.description: Find a peaceful sojourn in rivers and mountains inviting a spiritual encounter with nature.

Fukusa-Asian Art Museum.name: Fukusa
Fukusa-Asian Art Museum.description:
Get lost in the intricate details and expert techniques of 
fukusa
, used to adorn special gifts in Japan.

A Billion Buddhas: The Awakened Ones in.name: A Billion Buddhas: The Awakened Ones in Himalayan Tradition
A Billion Buddhas: The Awakened Ones in.description: Get to know the many striking forms of the Buddha.

Myself Mona Ahmed-Asian Art Museum.name: Myself Mona Ahmed
Myself Mona Ahmed-Asian Art Museum.description: Powerfully intimate photographs document the complex and compelling world of Mona Ahmed.

Moving Objects: Learning from Local and.description:

Bay Area

 and share your thoughts on the future of museum collections.

Celebrity Forms and Figures-Asian Art Mu.name: Celebrity Forms and Figures
Celebrity Forms and Figures-Asian Art Mu.description: An eclectic mix of ancient and up-to-the-minute works engaging with the theme of celebrity.

2024 New Generation Bamboo Art Prize Win.name: 2024 New Generation Bamboo Art Prize Winners
2024 New Generation Bamboo Art Prize Win.description: Five fresh, award-winning approaches to a time-honored art.

Rustic Ceramics in the Japanese Teahouse.name: Rustic Ceramics in the Japanese Teahouse
Rustic Ceramics in the Japanese Teahouse.description: Currently featuring a seasonal display of rustic ceramics by Tsujimura Shiro.

Qi Baishi: Inspiration in Ink-Asian Art.name: Qi Baishi: Inspiration in Ink
Qi Baishi: Inspiration in Ink-Asian Art.description: An intimate look at a modern master whose work revitalized traditional Chinese ink painting.

Beautiful, Bountiful, Boisterous Birds-A.name: Beautiful, Bountiful, Boisterous Birds
Beautiful, Bountiful, Boisterous Birds-A.description: Enjoy a stimulating session of colorful birdwatching — no binoculars required.

Yuan Goang-Ming: Everyday War-Asian Art.name: Yuan Goang-Ming: Everyday War
Yuan Goang-Ming: Everyday War-Asian Art.description: A leading video artist offers a dreamlike look at an increasingly unsettling world.

Por el Pueblo: The Legacy & Influence of.name: Por el Pueblo: The Legacy & Influence of Malaquías Montoya
Por el Pueblo: The Legacy & Influence of.description: Explore the living impact of Chicano artist, Malaquías Montoya, whose legacy as a public-serving artist, activist, and community elder serves as inspiration for younger generations within the Chicano community and beyond. Montoya’s posters, graphic prints, and murals highlighting political and social justice issues have helped define the Chicano identity for nearly five decades.

Calli: The Art of Xicanx Peoples-Oakland.name: Calli: The Art of Xicanx Peoples
Calli: The Art of Xicanx Peoples-Oakland.description: On view now—Experience intergenerational, feminist, queer, and Xicanx-Indigenous artworks offering ancestral forms of liberation, healing, and being at Calli: The Art of Xicanx Peoples, only at OMCA. Calli layers multiple artistic perspectives, featuring posters from late queer Chicana activist and professor Margaret “Margie” Terrazas Santos’ collection in conversation with contemporary works by Xicanx artists who expand the horizons of possibility, inspiring reflection and fostering dialogue about a world in which we can all belong.

You Are Here: California Stories on the.name: You Are Here: California Stories on the Map
You Are Here: California Stories on the.description: We all use maps in our everyday lives—to navigate public transportation, find places to eat, and visualize big data like weather patterns or political opinions. But have you ever considered the deeper stories maps tell us?

Black Power-Oakland Museum of California.name: Black Power
Black Power-Oakland Museum of California.description: Uncover the history of the Black Power movements in California with a compelling addition to the Gallery of California History. In response to the widely-popular 2016 exhibition All Power to the People: Black Panthers at 50, this installation illustrates the creative ways Black anti-racist activists in California supported their communities and challenged the U.S. government.

OMCA Kids: Nature Playspace-Oakland Muse.name: OMCA Kids: Nature Playspace
OMCA Kids: Nature Playspace-Oakland Muse.description: Little learners can unleash their curiosity and imagination in the newly created OMCA Kids: Nature Playspace. Located inside the Gallery of California Natural Sciences, the playspace is focused on the unique needs of children ages 2 to 5, along with their families and caregivers

Remembering Artist Hung Liu-Oakland Muse.name: Remembering Artist Hung Liu
Remembering Artist Hung Liu-Oakland Muse.description: Drawing from our collection, this installation features four of Liu’s works in our Gallery of California Art, offering a quiet setting for visitors to enjoy and appreciate her work, as well as space for remembrance and reflection, including opportunities to contribute memories of Liu.

Into the Brightness: Artists from Creati.name: Into the Brightness: Artists from Creativity Explored, Creative Growth & NIAD
Into the Brightness: Artists from Creati.description: In collaboration with three profound Bay Area institutions, Into the Brightness: Artists from Creativity Explored, Creative Growth, & NIAD celebrates myriad works from contemporary artists with developmental disabilities.

Angela Davis\u2013Seize the Time-Oakland.name: Angela Davis–Seize the Time
Angela Davis\u2013Seize the Time-Oakland.description: Angela Davis — Seize the Time, examines the image, influence, and activism of the Oakland-based icon. With a focus on her arrest, incarceration, trial, and the national and international campaigns to free her, Seize the Time will highlight Davis’s legacy as well as her ongoing role as an important contemporary figure for artists and activists.

Hella Feminist-Oakland Museum of Califor.name: Hella Feminist
Hella Feminist-Oakland Museum of Califor.description: Feminism. It’s a loaded word; as empowering to some as it is challenging for others. OMCA takes on this complex and timely topic with Hella Feminist, celebrating the lesser-known stories of feminism here in Oakland and the Bay Area.

Edith Heath: A Life in Clay-Oakland Muse.name: Edith Heath: A Life in Clay
Edith Heath: A Life in Clay-Oakland Muse.description: Trailblazer. Rebel. Revolutionary. Discover the story of Edith Heath, founder and designer of Heath Ceramics. Heath transformed the ceramics industry, creating dinnerware from California clay for “Sunday best” and everyday use.

Mothership: Voyage Into Afrofuturism-Oak.name: Mothership: Voyage Into Afrofuturism
Mothership: Voyage Into Afrofuturism-Oak.description: Afrofuturism is a lot of things. It’s the past, present, and future reimagined through a Black cultural lens. Visionary, spiritual, and generative, it is art, music, literature, and cinema that expresses a just future where Black people and Black ideas thrive. It is fantasy and science fiction that envisions the African Diaspora and Black culture as central in a technically advanced and culturally rich civilization. It is also the ordinary—now— in this very moment and the everyday pleasures that may often be seen as mundane. Afrofuturism is a strategy for Black community building.

No Spectators: The Art of Burning Man-Oa.name: No Spectators: The Art of Burning Man
No Spectators: The Art of Burning Man-Oa.description: Marvel at the spectacular artwork and large-scale installations from one of the most widely-celebrated cultural events in the world when No Spectators: The Art of Burning Man takes over OMCA in Fall of 2019.

Collecting a Moment-Oakland Museum of Ca.name: Collecting a Moment
Collecting a Moment-Oakland Museum of Ca.description: This selection of new additions to the OMCA collection highlights the art and culture of the moment and illuminates history in the making. The works in the installation are the result of OMCA’s new collecting process that seeks to respond to timely issues that impact the communities of Oakland and California. Representing a move away from more traditional museum collecting priorities, Collecting the Moment shows some of the ways we center our institutional relationships with diverse community groups and voices. This ongoing and changing installation will reveal some of the many ways California artists, activists, and others claim cultural space, question societal norms, gain power, and engage the larger questions of our time.

Born of the Bear Dance: Dugan Aguilar\u2.name: Born of the Bear Dance: Dugan Aguilar’s Photographs of Native California
Born of the Bear Dance: Dugan Aguilar\u2.description: Experience the diverse voices of California’s Indigenous peoples as they shape the present and future through the lens of celebrated Indigenous photographer Dugan Aguilar.OMCA’s latest exhibition, Born of the Bear Dance: Dugan Aguilar’s Photographs of Native California offers guests a first look at a significant collection that highlights Indigenous endurance and explores the vivid tapestry of contemporary Indigenous California life.

Under the Sky-Kala Art Institute.name: Under the Sky
Under the Sky-Kala Art Institute.description: Demetri Broxton, Kota Ezawa, Cathy Lu, Adia Millett, Emmanuel Montoya, Gregory Rick, Rupy C. Tut, Minoosh Zomorodinia Curated by Mayumi Hamanaka  Closing Reception & Artist Talk: Saturday, June 29, 2-4pm Read a review Kala’s Half-Century Under the Sky on East Bay Express written by Janis Hashe.

The AHA Annual Exhibition-Kala Art Insti.description: Artists and students at Berkeley High School.

Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste F.name: Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste Future
Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste F.description:
Asian American Women Artists Association (AAWAA), ARTogether, Discostan, and Oakland Asian Cultural Center co-presents “Dalit Dreamlands: Toward an Anti-Caste Future” – a landmark multimedia Dalit art exhibition and dance party that will bring together over 30 multiply marginalized artists from Dalit*, Adivasi*, Bahujan*, Afro-Indian, Indo-Caribbean, and Muslim communities to showcase the depths of creativity and community.
Dalit Dreamlands, curated by Manu Kaur (they/them) and supported through AAWAA’s Emerging Curator’s Program, will center queer and trans caste abolitionist futurisms through art across various mediums, including fashion design, music, performances, films, paintings and visuals. One of the headlining artists, Malvika Raj, is a Dalit artist who challenges the casteist restrictions present in the Madhubani style of painting, by incorporating pro-Dalit assertions into her intricate and hypnotizing designs. Nazrina Rodjan is a queer Indo-Surinamese artist who integrates the history of indentured labor and femme resilience within her large paintings of indentured Indian women.
London-based trans Dalit artist Mya Mehmi from Pxssy Palace will be one of four guest DJs and performers at the opening reception dance party in collaboration with Discostan’s Arshia Fatima Haq. Dalit Dreamlands is a historic event that marks one of the first queer Dalit-centered spaces to exist in California.
*Dalit is a caste marker for caste-oppressed communities formerly known as Untouchables, Adivasi refers to tribes who are indigenous to South Asia, and Bahujan is an umbrella term that includes all caste-oppressed communities.
 
CURATOR
Manu Kaur
EXHIBITING ARTISTS
Rinku Kumari, Jessie Sohpaul, Shivam Kamble, Nazrina Rodjan, Manpreet Singh, Malvika Raj, Seema Mattu, Mya Mehmi, Seema Hari, Shyama Kuver, Akhil Kang, Kaushik Tadvi, Rahee Punyashloka, Aravind Chedayan, Ajay Madhukar Dhoke, Shweta Ashokraj, Kamna Singh, Anika Nawar Ullah, Aindriya Barua, Ramnath Siddi, Siddi Tribe of Karnataka, Nrithya Pillai, Dalit Queer Project, Parth Pawar, Imaan Abbasi, Sri Vamsi Matta, R V Purusothaman (Purushu Arie), Shradha Raj, Jay Sagathia, Dee Chawla, Mia Kaur, Riri Kumbhar, Rohini bhadarge, John Spencer, Kulpreet Rana, & Simrah Farrukh
Event graphic by Parth Pawar.

Longing for Attachment-Oakland Asian Cul.name: Longing for Attachment
Longing for Attachment-Oakland Asian Cul.description:
ARTogether and Oakland Asian Cultural Center co-present “Longing for Attachment,” an exhibition curated by Bushra Gill featuring 30+ Bay Area 1st/2nd generation immigrant and refugee artists reflecting on the notion of attachments. 

As immigrants, refugees, and their descendants, we make choices on what to hold onto and what to let go of when moving to another country or culture. Being too attached to a place or way of being can make it hard to form connections to anything new. But our connection to a place is also related to our quality of life and well-being– it links us to neighborhoods and communities where we have lived.  Anyone who has migrated from another country or grown up in an immigrant family knows these attachments run deep and true, not needing to be present to have a prominent place in our hearts.   

We invite you to join us in reflection of our relationships to attachment, and to celebrate these Bay Area refugee, immigrant, and children of immigrant artists.

We Plant Our Feet in the Sky-Oakland Asi.name: We Plant Our Feet in the Sky
We Plant Our Feet in the Sky-Oakland Asi.description: What is ours to call home? “We Plant Our Feet in the Sky” is a group exhibition showcasing mixed medium art, performance, and poetry exploring uncharted imagination extending beyond borders, and celebrating the complexities of our authentic lives. We imagine a world full of hopeful possibilities, one that is welcoming of our diasporic and queer identities in all of their fullness.

TT Takemoto: Remembering in the Absence.name: TT Takemoto: Remembering in the Absence of Memory

Beyond Here: The Judy and Sidney Zuber C.name: Beyond Here: The Judy and Sidney Zuber Collection of Latin American Photography

Reality Makes Them Dream: American Photo.name: Reality Makes Them Dream: American Photography, 1929–1941

A Change of Scenery: Photographs of Leis.name: A Change of Scenery: Photographs of Leisure in the Landscape

Yinka Shonibare CBE, RA: The American Li.name: Yinka Shonibare CBE, RA: The American Library

East of the Pacific: Making Histories of.name: East of the Pacific: Making Histories of Asian American Art

At Home/On Stage: Asian American Represe.name: At Home/On Stage: Asian American Representation in Photography and Film

LJ Roberts: Carry You With Me-Cantor Art.name: LJ Roberts: Carry You With Me

The Marmor Collection: Color as Form in.name: The Marmor Collection: Color as Form in Prints, 1953–1971

Ian Cheng: Emissary Sunsets The Self-Can.name: Ian Cheng: Emissary Sunsets The Self

The Marmor Collection: Black and White P.name: The Marmor Collection: Black and White Prints from the 1970s

First Impressions: Frank Stella\u2019s E.name: First Impressions: Frank Stella’s Early Prints from the Marmor Collection

Second Nature: Photography in the Age of.name: Second Nature: Photography in the Age of the Anthropocene

Art Wall / Rose D\u2019Amato: Mission Ch.name: Art Wall / Rose D’Amato: Mission Chevrolet
Art Wall / Rose D\u2019Amato: Mission Ch.description: Rose D’Amato (b. 1991, Whittier, California) is a second-generation sign painter and pinstriper. Her abstract compositions celebrate this personal lineage as a representation of the ingenuity of Latinx and working-class communities and the traditions of self-presentation embodied in lowrider culture. For her first museum exhibition, she created an Art Wall commission based on the recently exposed Mission Chevrolet Service billboard—a historic hand-painted sign in San Francisco—to memorialize and celebrate this formerly hidden emblem of community and artistic labor.

MATRIX 285 / Young Joon Kwak: Resistance.name: MATRIX 285 / Young Joon Kwak: Resistance Pleasure
MATRIX 285 / Young Joon Kwak: Resistance.description: Young Joon Kwak (b. 1984, Queens, New York) works across sculpture, performance, and video to create works that resist the boundaries of representation. In MATRIX 285 / Young Joon Kwak: Resistance Pleasure, the artist casts the human form in sculptures where the body is fragmented and installed throughout the gallery, suggesting a series of movements or gestures within the space.

To Exalt the Ephemeral: The (Im)permanen.name: To Exalt the Ephemeral: The (Im)permanent Collection
To Exalt the Ephemeral: The (Im)permanen.description: To Exalt the Ephemeral: The (Im)permanent Collection draws from BAMPFA’s art and film collections to explore how museums collect, care for, and amplify the work of artists who celebrate ideas of impermanence and cycles of decay and regeneration. View

Teaching Wall / Water, Art, and Californ.name: Teaching Wall / Water, Art, and California

On the Outdoor Screen / Kathryn Andrews:.name: On the Outdoor Screen / Kathryn Andrews: Victoria Woodhull, Belva Ann Lockwood, Abigail Scott Duniway [ . . . ]
On the Outdoor Screen / Kathryn Andrews:.description: In anticipation of the upcoming 2024 election, BAMPFA presents Los Angeles–based artist Kathryn Andrews’s work Victoria Woodhull, Belva Ann Lockwood, Abigail Scott Duniway [ . . . ], which addresses the gender disparity among US presidents. Chronicling nearly 150 years of women vying for the presidential seat.

On the Outdoor Screen / Lena Wolff and H.name: On the Outdoor Screen / Lena Wolff and Hope Meng: Art for Democracy
On the Outdoor Screen / Lena Wolff and H.description: Beginning one month prior to Election Day 2024, BAMPFA presents Bay Area artist Lena Wolff’s clarion call to civic engagement on our Outdoor Screen. Wolff made these voting posters in collaboration with the multidisciplinary designer Hope Meng. Initially launched in 2017, Wolff’s iconic poster series encourages viewers to make their voices heard at the ballot box in support of urgent and timely issues: reproductive freedom, gun reform, trans rights, environmental justice, and democracy at large.

On the Outdoor Screen / Michele Pred: Un.name: On the Outdoor Screen / Michele Pred: United for Freedom
On the Outdoor Screen / Michele Pred: Un.description: Since 2016, Pred has organized numerous feminist and GOTV (Get Out The Vote) art parades, blending art and activism to inspire change. This exhibition highlights Pred’s ongoing commitment to reproductive justice, freedom, and women’s rights, featuring an image from her iconic 2018 Vote Feminist parade in New York City.

BODY FREEDOM FOR EVERY(BODY)-BAMPFA.name: BODY FREEDOM FOR EVERY(BODY)
BODY FREEDOM FOR EVERY(BODY)-BAMPFA.description: Catch BODY FREEDOM FOR EVERY(BODY) on its cross-country exhibition tour at BAMPFA! The tour’s 27-foot box truck shares the work of over 100 artists on intersecting themes of Reproductive Justice, Queer Liberation, and Trans Joy through contemporary art. This project champions bodily autonomy and aims to reinforce community(ies), create safe spaces, and cultivate joy.

Making Their Mark: Works from the Shah G.name: Making Their Mark: Works from the Shah Garg Collection
Making Their Mark: Works from the Shah G.description: Making Their Mark brings together more than seventy artworks by women artists from the Shah Garg Collection, illuminating transgenerational affinities, influences, and methodologies among pathbreaking artists from the postwar era to the present.

Routed West: Twentieth-Century African A.name: Routed West: Twentieth-Century African American Quilts in California
Routed West: Twentieth-Century African A.description: Routed West: Twentieth-Century African American Quilts in California traces the flow and flourishing of quilts in the context of the Second Great Migration. These quilts explore the medium’s unique capacity for connecting kin across time and space, holding memory and ancestral knowledge, and opening up space for beauty and ingenuity.

MITH & CO.: Fifty-Fourth Annual UC Berke.name: MITH & CO.: Fifty-Fourth Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Exhibition
MITH & CO.: Fifty-Fourth Annual UC Berke.description: For more than half a century, BAMPFA and the UC Berkeley Department of Art Practice have collaborated to present an exhibition of works by MFA graduates. This year’s exhibition features the exceptional work of Salimatu Amabebe, Anamaya Farthing-Kohl, Valencia James, and Nivedita Madigubba.

A Movement in Every Direction: Legacies.name: A Movement in Every Direction: Legacies of the Great Migration
A Movement in Every Direction: Legacies.description: A Movement in Every Direction: Legacies of the Great Migration illuminates the enduring impressions of the Great Migration through the eyes and work of twelve contemporary artists.

On the Outdoor Screen: Navigating the Pi.name: On the Outdoor Screen: Navigating the Pilot School
On the Outdoor Screen: Navigating the Pi.description: 10 AM, 2 PM, and 6 PM daily. 6 PM only on 4/24

Art Wall / Yee I-Lann: TIKAR/MEJA/PLASTI.name: Art Wall / Yee I-Lann: TIKAR/MEJA/PLASTIK
Art Wall / Yee I-Lann: TIKAR/MEJA/PLASTI.description: Yee I-Lann’s (b. 1971, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysian Borneo) multidisciplinary practice interrogates the complex geopolitical histories of Southeast Asia. For her first major solo presentation at a US museum, the artist has created sixty new works as part of her ongoing TIKAR/MEJA series for BAMPFA’s Art Wall.

On the Outdoor Screen: Lessons in Semaph.name: On the Outdoor Screen: Lessons in Semaphore
On the Outdoor Screen: Lessons in Semaph.description: In conjunction with the film series Cauleen Smith—In Space, In Time, view Lessons in Semaphore on BAMPFA’s outdoor screen. Filmed with Cauleen Smith’s beloved but broken wind-up 16mm camera in a verdant vacant lot on Chicago’s South Side, choreographer Taisha Paggett performs signals with artist-made flags.

MATRIX 284 / Sin Wai Kin: The Story Chan.name: MATRIX 284 / Sin Wai Kin: The Story Changing
MATRIX 284 / Sin Wai Kin: The Story Chan.description: Sin Wai Kin uses speculative fiction and storytelling to create multilayered performances and moving image works. The Story Changing, the artist’s first solo exhibition in the United States, explores how forms of embodiment and multiplicity have the potential to transform social narratives.

MATRIX 283 / Gabriel Chaile: No hay nada.name: MATRIX 283 / Gabriel Chaile: No hay nada que destruya el corazón como la pobreza
MATRIX 283 / Gabriel Chaile: No hay nada.description: Playfully intertwining Indigenous mythologies and contemporary social references, Gabriel Chaile creates soaring clay sculptures that expand on the forms, rituals, and traditions of precolonial cultures in northwestern Argentina. MATRIX 283 / Gabriel Chaile features all newly commissioned work, and is the artist’s first solo museum presentation in the United States.

Duane Linklater: mymothersside-BAMPFA.name: Duane Linklater: mymothersside
Duane Linklater: mymothersside-BAMPFA.description: For over a decade, Duane Linklater has been making art that interrogates the construct of museums, their conventions, and their historical exclusion of Indigenous people and content. Working across a range of media—including painting, sculpture, and video—he addresses the contradictions of contemporary Indigenous life within settler systems of knowledge, representation, and value. Duane Linklater: mymothersside is the artist’s first major survey exhibition.

MATRIX 282 / Griselda Rosas: Yo te cuido.name: MATRIX 282 / Griselda Rosas: Yo te cuido
MATRIX 282 / Griselda Rosas: Yo te cuido.description: Griselda Rosas / MATRIX 282: Yo te cuido presents the artist’s textile drawings and sculptural installations, addressing the complexities of the US-Mexico border region by drawing from colonial histories, familial traditions, and personal experience. Themes of inheritance and intergenerational knowledge recur in Rosas’s work alongside references to single motherhood.

MATRIX 281 / Kenneth Tam: The Founding o.name: MATRIX 281 / Kenneth Tam: The Founding of the World
MATRIX 281 / Kenneth Tam: The Founding o.description: For MATRIX 281, Kenneth Tam’s latest video and sculptural installation makes its museum debut at BAMPFA. Incorporating the artist’s long-standing research into culturally prescriptive forms of masculinity, The Founding of the World interrogates themes of group identity, ritualized violence, belonging, and intimacy.

Art Wall: Xylor Jane-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Xylor Jane
Art Wall: Xylor Jane-BAMPFA.description: For BAMPFA’s Art Wall, Xylor Jane presents a pyramidal calendar organized by the fifth palindromic triangular number, 666—a number with myriad positive and negative connotations. A black grid outlines the color-coded days of the week, while hand-drawn notations mark full moons, equinoxes, and solstices to queer and cross-reference the relationship of natural cycles with European constructions of time.

What Has Been and What Could Be: The BAM.name: What Has Been and What Could Be: The BAMPFA Collection
What Has Been and What Could Be: The BAM.description: What Has Been and What Could Be: The BAMPFA Collection inaugurates a year-long presentation of the BAMPFA collection, bringing a contemporary perspective to the museum’s global art holdings.

Fifty-Third Annual UC Berkeley Master of.name: Fifty-Third Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Exhibition
Fifty-Third Annual UC Berkeley Master of.description: For over half a century, BAMPFA and the UC Berkeley Department of Art Practice have collaborated to present an exhibition of works by Master of Fine Arts graduates. This year’s exhibition includes the exceptional work of Irma Yuliana Barbosa, Gericault De La Rose, Eniola Fakile, Juniper Harrower, Fei Pan, Tiare Ribeaux, and Samuel Wildman.

Alexandre Dumas\u2019s Afro: Blackness C.name: Alexandre Dumas’s Afro: Blackness Caricatured, Erased, and Back Again

On the Hour: Three short films by Willia.name: On the Hour: Three short films by William Kentridge
On the Hour: Three short films by Willia.description: This trio of short animated films by William Kentridge demonstrate his interest in patterns associated with stream of consciousness thought, transformation, language, abstraction, and time. He uses the formal principles and building blocks of cinema, i.e. the illusion of movement that is created when the eye sees 24 frames per second, and manipulates the single film frame to make these magical works.

Out of Africa: Selections from the Kraml.name: Out of Africa: Selections from the Kramlich Collection
Out of Africa: Selections from the Kraml.description: This selection of photographs and two video installations centers the continent of Africa as a site of extraction, exploitation, and displacement for economic gain.

Apichatpong Weerasethakul \"Morakot (Eme.name: Apichatpong Weerasethakul "Morakot (Emerald)"
Apichatpong Weerasethakul \"Morakot (Eme.description: Endless Knot: Struggle and Healing in the Buddhist World

Amalia Mesa-Bains: Archaeology of Memory.name: Amalia Mesa-Bains: Archaeology of Memory
Amalia Mesa-Bains: Archaeology of Memory.description: Amalia Mesa-Bains: Archaeology of Memory is the first retrospective exhibition of the work of longtime Bay Area artist Mesa-Bains. Presenting work from the entirety of her career for the first time, this exhibition, which features nearly 60 works in a range of media, including fourteen major installations, celebrates Mesa-Bains’s important contributions to the field of contemporary art locally and globally.

Frank Moore / MATRIX 280: Theater of Hum.name: Frank Moore / MATRIX 280: Theater of Human Melting
Frank Moore / MATRIX 280: Theater of Hum.description: This exhibition represents a small portion of the vast body of creative work by the late Berkeley-based artist and teacher Frank Moore (1946–2013). Over the course of more than five decades, Moore, who was born with a physical disability, used painting, performance, public access television, and an extensive writing practice to explore the unlimited capacity for humans to connect.

Rina Kimche-BAMPFA.name: Rina Kimche
Rina Kimche-BAMPFA.description: This is the first solo exhibition in the United States of the work of Israeli-based artist Rina Kimche (born 1934). Kimche’s diminutive sculptures are modern in their reductive, abstract simplicity and in their expression of the material essence of their clay medium.

Endless Knot: Struggle and Healing in th.name: Endless Knot: Struggle and Healing in the Buddhist World
Endless Knot: Struggle and Healing in th.description: Endless Knot: Struggle and Healing in the Buddhist World explores how artists and practitioners across two millennia have understood and utilized one of the core tenets of Buddhism—dependent arising, which posits that cycles of existence (saṃsāra) arise from past actions and that everything in the world can impact everything else.

Art Wall: Luis Camnitzer-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Luis Camnitzer
Art Wall: Luis Camnitzer-BAMPFA.description: In his West Coast solo project debut, Uruguayan artist Luis Camnitzer (b. 1937) debuts the new work below/here/above/ahead/was as part of BAMPFA’s Art Wall commissioned series.

Lena Wolff and Hope Meng: VOTE-BAMPFA.name: Lena Wolff and Hope Meng: VOTE
Lena Wolff and Hope Meng: VOTE-BAMPFA.description: The return of Wolff’s iconic poster series encourages viewers to make their voices heard at the ballot box in support of urgent and timely issues: for reproductive freedom, gun reform, trans rights, environmental justice, and democracy at large.

Undoing Time: Art and Histories of Incar.name: Undoing Time: Art and Histories of Incarceration
Undoing Time: Art and Histories of Incar.description: Undoing Time: Art and Histories of Incarceration considers the foundational roots of confinement from philosophical, sociological, theological, and art historical perspectives to better understand the fact that today’s mass incarceration crisis has been centuries in the making. This exhibition traces images from history that contribute to the entrenched cultural beliefs associated with today’s carceral system.

Hannah Levy / MATRIX 279-BAMPFA.name: Hannah Levy / MATRIX 279
Hannah Levy / MATRIX 279-BAMPFA.description: Hannah Levy’s tactile, creaturelike sculptures infuse the stripped-down lines of Modernist design with a visceral tension that is simultaneously sterile and erotic, amusing and disturbing.

Fluxus Reverb: Events, Scores, Boxes & M.name: Fluxus Reverb: Events, Scores, Boxes & More
Fluxus Reverb: Events, Scores, Boxes & M.description: An international movement of the 1960s and 1970s of artists working across disciplines and in a decidedly anti-commercial manner, this exhibition offers an opportunity to see Fluxus materials and many artworks in the form of a box, including numerous Fluxkits by a wide variety of artists.

by Alison Knowles: A Retrospective (1960.name: by Alison Knowles: A Retrospective (1960–2022)
by Alison Knowles: A Retrospective (1960.description: Best known as a core member of Fluxus, the first comprehensive exhibition of Knowles's work, spanning the entire breadth of her still-active career, from her intermedia works of the 1960s to participatory and relational art from the 2000s.

Whitney Bradshaw: OUTCRY-BAMPFA.name: Whitney Bradshaw: OUTCRY
Whitney Bradshaw: OUTCRY-BAMPFA.description: This large-scale presentation of Bradshaw's photographic project features one hundred women engaging in unbridled self-expression as an act of defiance against patriarchal oppression. Running three times daily on the outdoor screen.

The 52nd Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fi.name: The 52nd Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Graduate Exhibition
The 52nd Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fi.description: BAMPFA and the UC Berkeley Department of Art Practice host an exhibition of works by the Master of Fine Arts class of 2022: Erica Deeman, Edgar Fabián Frías, Kavena Hambira, Hala Kaddoura, Ahn Lee, and Rivka Valérie Louissaint.

Candice Lin: Seeping, Rotting, Resting,.name: Candice Lin: Seeping, Rotting, Resting, Weeping

Art Wall: Caroline Kent-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Caroline Kent
Art Wall: Caroline Kent-BAMPFA.description: BAMPFA commissioned Chicago-based artist Caroline Kent to present The Sounds Among Us, a large-scale, self-reflective yet otherworldly meditation on the museum as a site of intimate performance and public engagement.

On the Hour: A Cool Million-BAMPFA.name: On the Hour: A Cool Million
On the Hour: A Cool Million-BAMPFA.description: This Earth Week, BAMPFA is proud to be participating in this public initiative for climate awareness led by artists and institutions to expand environmental arts programming and support the conservation of land central to the California hydrological cycle.

The Artist\u2019s Eye: Tammy Rae Carland.name: The Artist’s Eye: Tammy Rae Carland, David Huffman, Lava Thomas, John Zurier
The Artist\u2019s Eye: Tammy Rae Carland.description: Curated by four established Bay Area artists, this exhibition centers their respective artistic visions and engages the space where the artist—as curator, collector, and maker—meets the museum.

Recent Acquisitions from the BAMPFA Coll.name: Recent Acquisitions from the BAMPFA Collection
Recent Acquisitions from the BAMPFA Coll.description: This exhibition of recent acquisitions by the museum demonstrates BAMPFA’s ongoing work to expand the global art historical canon through the art of lesser known makers and marginalized groups.

Spiritual Mountains: The Art of Wesley T.name: Spiritual Mountains: The Art of Wesley Tongson
Spiritual Mountains: The Art of Wesley T.description: This exhibition debuts a recent gift of eleven Tongson paintings and pairs them with historic paintings from BAMPFA’s extensive Chinese painting collection, demonstrating the relationship between his genius and that of past masters.

Lines of Thought-BAMPFA.name: Lines of Thought
Lines of Thought-BAMPFA.description: Gestural Abstraction in the BAMPFA Collection

On the Hour: Night Watch-BAMPFA.name: On the Hour: Night Watch
On the Hour: Night Watch-BAMPFA.description: Screening hourly on BAMPFA's Outdoor Screen, Shimon Attie's 2018 video work features twelve portraits of refugees who fled violence and discrimination in their homeland and were granted political asylum in the United States.

New Time: Art and Feminisms in the 21st.name: New Time: Art and Feminisms in the 21st Century
New Time: Art and Feminisms in the 21st.description: Featuring more than 150 works, most made since the year 2000, this major survey presents a kaleidoscopic view of feminist practices in contemporary art.

The Enduring Mark-BAMPFA.name: The Enduring Mark
The Enduring Mark-BAMPFA.description: Six Centuries of Drawing from the Gray Collection

Art Wall: Luchita Hurtado-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Luchita Hurtado
Art Wall: Luchita Hurtado-BAMPFA.description: Developed from a drawing that delineates the differing strata of earth's material structure, BAMPFA's Art Wall commission is Hurtado's most monumental painting to date and among the last works she made.

The 51st Annual University of California.name: The 51st Annual University of California, Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Graduate Exhibition
The 51st Annual University of California.description: BAMPFA presents works by this year’s MFA graduates from the Department of Art Practice at Cal.

Kay Sekimachi: Geometries-BAMPFA.name: Kay Sekimachi: Geometries
Kay Sekimachi: Geometries-BAMPFA.description: This survey spans the innovative career of Kay Sekimachi, whose experimental objects fold together art and craft, found and made, and Japanese and American artistic traditions.

The 50th Annual University of California.name: The 50th Annual University of California, Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Graduate Exhibition
The 50th Annual University of California.description: After a pandemic-related postponement, we showcase works by 2020 graduates from the MFA program at Cal.

Ulrike Ottinger / MATRIX 276-BAMPFA.name: Ulrike Ottinger / MATRIX 276
Ulrike Ottinger / MATRIX 276-BAMPFA.description: In tandem with a streaming series of Ulrike Ottinger’s films, this exhibition highlights her work as a photographer, revealing her keen eye for landscape and intimate portraiture.

Present Tense: Five Centuries of Colonia.name: Present Tense: Five Centuries of Colonialism in Latin American and Caribbean Art

Beyond Boundaries: Buddhist Art of Gandh.name: Beyond Boundaries: Buddhist Art of Gandhara
Beyond Boundaries: Buddhist Art of Gandh.description: Northern India’s Gandharan region was a crossroads of power, culture, and art from the second to ninth centuries. Rare sculptural images of the Buddha and his life story reflect cultural exchanges between the Hellenistic world and the native artistic traditions of India.

Orbits of Known and Unknown Objects: SFA.name: Orbits of Known and Unknown Objects: SFAI Histories / MATRIX 277
Orbits of Known and Unknown Objects: SFA.description: An exhibition in the form of a website, MATRIX 277 explores and honors the rich legacy of the San Francisco Art Institute on the occasion of its 150th anniversary, tracing connections among artworks, people, and places over the trajectory of the institution’s history.

When All That Is Solid Melts into Air-BA.name: When All That Is Solid Melts into Air
When All That Is Solid Melts into Air-BA.description: Exploring the Intersection of the Folk and the Modern in Postcolonial India

Art for Human Rights: Peace Now!-BAMPFA.name: Art for Human Rights: Peace Now!
Art for Human Rights: Peace Now!-BAMPFA.description: A selection of protest posters made in Berkeley in the sixties and seventies offers a chance to reflect on an era when Americans were at war with one another while waging war abroad.

Rosie Lee Tompkins: A Retrospective-BAMP.name: Rosie Lee Tompkins: A Retrospective
Rosie Lee Tompkins: A Retrospective-BAMP.description: The largest exhibition of Rosie Lee Tompkins’s work to date, this retrospective reveals her as a brilliantly inventive quiltmaker and an artist of stunning variety, depth, and impact.

Ron Nagle: Handsome Drifter-BAMPFA.name: Ron Nagle: Handsome Drifter
Ron Nagle: Handsome Drifter-BAMPFA.description: Ron Nagle’s small sculptures combine modernism, pop culture, and sensory pleasure in compact, perfect packages.

Brave Warriors and Fantastic Tales: The.name: Brave Warriors and Fantastic Tales: The World According to Yoshitoshi
Brave Warriors and Fantastic Tales: The.description: Legendary warriors and fantastical creatures come to life in the daring prints of Taiso Yoshitoshi, one of the last great ukiyo-e artists of Meiji Japan.

Lands of Promise and Peril: Geographies.name: Lands of Promise and Peril: Geographies of California

Art Wall: Edie Fake-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Edie Fake
Art Wall: Edie Fake-BAMPFA.description: Edie Fake’s mural envisions affordable housing for transgender elders, using architecture to celebrate the uniqueness of trans bodies and the possibilities of queer space.

Sylvia Fein / MATRIX 275-BAMPFA.name: Sylvia Fein / MATRIX 275
Sylvia Fein / MATRIX 275-BAMPFA.description: This career-spanning centenary tribute of Sylvia Fein showcases a wide array of works drawing on both the personal and the fantastical.

Dennis Feldman: Photographs-BAMPFA.name: Dennis Feldman: Photographs
Dennis Feldman: Photographs-BAMPFA.description: Photographs from two series, Hollywood Boulevard, 1969–1972 and American Images, demonstrate the artist’s achievements as an affecting social documentarian and explorer of what he calls “a world contained in a frame.”

Terry Fox: Resonance-BAMPFA.name: Terry Fox: Resonance
Terry Fox: Resonance-BAMPFA.description: Two of Terry Fox’s video and audio works are being presented at BAMPFA in conjunction with Terry Fox: Resonance, a multivenue celebration organized by Dena Beard and Constance Lewallen.

Hinges: Sakaki Hyakusen and the Birth of.name: Hinges: Sakaki Hyakusen and the Birth of Nanga Painting
Hinges: Sakaki Hyakusen and the Birth of.description: The first US exhibition focused on Sakaki Hyakusen, the founding father of the Nanga school of painting in Japan, this presentation reveals his pivotal role in the history of eighteenth-century Japanese art and highlights the conservation of his masterpiece Mountain Landscape.

Kader Attia / MATRIX 274-BAMPFA.name: Kader Attia / MATRIX 274
Kader Attia / MATRIX 274-BAMPFA.description: Part of French-Algerian artist Kader Attia’s ongoing investigation of the concept of repair and healing from the trauma of war, this exhibition presents his seminal installation J’accuse.

The San Quentin Project: Nigel Poor and.name: The San Quentin Project: Nigel Poor and the Men of San Quentin State Prison
The San Quentin Project: Nigel Poor and.description: Following the evolution of artist Nigel Poor’s collaboration with men incarcerated at San Quentin State Prison, this exhibition features visual documents, photographs from the prison’s archive, and episodes of the award-winning podcast Ear Hustle.

Strange-BAMPFA.name: Strange
Strange-BAMPFA.description: Featuring works from many cultures and time periods that resonate with the spirit of Surrealism, this exhibition explores the improbable, uncanny, mysterious, and miraculous as sources of artistic inspiration.

Meditation in Motion: Zen Calligraphy fr.name: Meditation in Motion: Zen Calligraphy from the Stuart Katz Collection
Meditation in Motion: Zen Calligraphy fr.description: The first exhibition at BAMPFA to present the unique art form of Japanese Zen-inspired calligraphy, Meditation in Motion features important works by Chinese Ōbaku monks who immigrated to Japan, as well as writings by Japanese monks who expanded on their examples.

No Horizon: Helen Mirra and Sean Thackre.name: No Horizon: Helen Mirra and Sean Thackrey
No Horizon: Helen Mirra and Sean Thackre.description: This exhibition brings together two Bay Area artists whose work embraces the simple act of seeing as an inspiration to deep reflection and understanding.

Divine Women, Divine Wisdom-BAMPFA.name: Divine Women, Divine Wisdom
Divine Women, Divine Wisdom-BAMPFA.description: Art from South Asia and the Himalayan region that celebrates the beauty, fecundity, wisdom, power, and compassion of women within the context of Hindu and Buddhist traditions.

The 49th Annual University of California.name: The 49th Annual University of California, Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Graduate Exhibition
The 49th Annual University of California.description: BAMPFA showcases work by the latest graduates from the MFA program at Cal.

About Things Loved: Blackness and Belong.name: About Things Loved: Blackness and Belonging

Permanent Accusation: Art for Human Righ.name: Permanent Accusation: Art for Human Rights
Permanent Accusation: Art for Human Righ.description: This presentation of work by Fernando Botero and others asks how art can urge accountability for human rights in ways that the law cannot.

Looking: The Art of Frederick Hammersley.name: Looking: The Art of Frederick Hammersley
Looking: The Art of Frederick Hammersley.description: Explore the extraordinary creativity of artist Frederick Hammersley in its full breadth, from painting and photography to computer art, in this exhibition marking a significant recent donation of the artist's work.

Unlimited: Recent Gifts from the William.name: Unlimited: Recent Gifts from the William Goodman and Victoria Belco Photography Collection
Unlimited: Recent Gifts from the William.description: Celebrating a major gift of photographs from a pair of local collectors, this exhibition features works by masters of the photographic form, with an emphasis on contemporary work from the Bay Area and around the world.

Art Wall: Carlos Amorales-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Carlos Amorales
Art Wall: Carlos Amorales-BAMPFA.description: This new commission draws on multiple histories of Mexican muralism, graffiti, and political protest, while reinforcing the importance of social engagement in the present moment.

Hans Hofmann: The Nature of Abstraction-.name: Hans Hofmann: The Nature of Abstraction
Hans Hofmann: The Nature of Abstraction-.description: Spanning the entirety of the artist’s career, this exhibition presents a fresh and eye-opening examination of Hans Hofmann’s prolific and innovative artistic practice.

Aaron Marcus: Early Works-BAMPFA.name: Aaron Marcus: Early Works
Aaron Marcus: Early Works-BAMPFA.description: In these multicolored transformations of computer-generated forms, the artist makes connections between art, science, design, and visual poetry.

Masako Miki / MATRIX 273-BAMPFA.name: Masako Miki / MATRIX 273
Masako Miki / MATRIX 273-BAMPFA.description: A magical installation inspired by Shinto beliefs and the shape-shifting beings of Japanese folklore.

Get Dancin\u2019: Selections from the Co.name: Get Dancin’: Selections from the Collection
Get Dancin\u2019: Selections from the Co.description: The exuberance, romance, and beauty of dance are central themes in this wide-ranging selection of works.

Ink, Paper, Silk: One Hundred Years of C.name: Ink, Paper, Silk: One Hundred Years of Collecting Japanese Art
Ink, Paper, Silk: One Hundred Years of C.description: An exceptional selection of scroll paintings, screens, woodblock prints, lacquerware, and ceramics demonstrating the breadth and beauty of Japanese art.

Arthur Jafa / MATRIX 272-BAMPFA.name: Arthur Jafa / MATRIX 272
Arthur Jafa / MATRIX 272-BAMPFA.description: A gallery exhibition and complementary screenings of videos by Arthur Jafa, whose work expands the concept of black cinema while exploring African American experience and race relations in everyday life.

Dimensionism: Modern Art in the Age of E.name: Dimensionism: Modern Art in the Age of Einstein
Dimensionism: Modern Art in the Age of E.description: Discover the connections between the scientific and artistic revolutions of the early twentieth century with this groundbreaking exhibition, which reveals how artists responded to scientific advances with bold new forms of creative expression.

Harvey Quaytman: Against the Static-BAMP.name: Harvey Quaytman: Against the Static
Harvey Quaytman: Against the Static-BAMP.description: This new retrospective charts the painter’s career from the 1960s through the 1990s, showcasing abstract experiments in form, texture, and color that are both formally rigorous and rich with sensuality and humor.

Boundless: Contemporary Tibetan Artists.name: Boundless: Contemporary Tibetan Artists at Home and Abroad
Boundless: Contemporary Tibetan Artists.description: Featuring works by renowned contemporary Tibetan artists alongside rare historical pieces, this exhibition highlights how artists explore the infinite possibilities of visual forms to reflect their transcultural, multilingual, and translocal lives.

Redacted: Art for Human Rights-BAMPFA.name: Redacted: Art for Human Rights
Redacted: Art for Human Rights-BAMPFA.description: A selection of works from the BAMPFA collection that use redacted content to question the relationships between power, information, and censorship and consider the precarious nature of truth.

Old Masters in a New Light: Rediscoverin.name: Old Masters in a New Light: Rediscovering the European Collection
Old Masters in a New Light: Rediscoverin.description: BAMPFA’s outstanding collection of historical European art—including several important new acquisitions—is showcased in this exhibition, the culmination of a major research and conservation effort.

Christina Quarles / MATRIX 271-BAMPFA.name: Christina Quarles / MATRIX 271
Christina Quarles / MATRIX 271-BAMPFA.description: A gathering of paintings by Quarles, whose work tussles with culturally prescribed identities and probes the margins where meaning remains unfixed, illegible, and subject to question.

Art Wall: Barbara Stauffacher Solomon-BA.name: Art Wall: Barbara Stauffacher Solomon
Art Wall: Barbara Stauffacher Solomon-BA.description: The pioneer of the 1960s design phenomenon Supergraphics creates a new piece for BAMPFA’s Art Wall.

Cecilia Vicu\u00f1a: About to Happen-BAM.name: Cecilia Vicuña: About to Happen
Cecilia Vicu\u00f1a: About to Happen-BAM.description: This first survey of Vicuña’s work stages a conversation about discarded and displaced people, places, and things in a time of global climate change.

Joanne Leonard: Intimate Documentary-BAM.name: Joanne Leonard: Intimate Documentary
Joanne Leonard: Intimate Documentary-BAM.description: Leonard’s photographs are rare, intimate documents of life in Oakland in the 1960s and 1970s.

Peter Hujar: Speed of Life-BAMPFA.name: Peter Hujar: Speed of Life
Peter Hujar: Speed of Life-BAMPFA.description: The first retrospective of an enormously influential artist whose photographs capture the creative subcultures of downtown New York in the 1970s and 1980s.

Way Bay 2-BAMPFA.name: Way Bay 2
Way Bay 2-BAMPFA.description: A fresh iteration of our innovative exhibition exploring the creative energies that have emerged from the Bay Area over the past two centuries.

Color, Form, Unicorn: Recent Acquisition.name: Color, Form, Unicorn: Recent Acquisitions
Color, Form, Unicorn: Recent Acquisition.description: Recent additions to the BAMPFA collection feature unusual approaches to color and form—plus a unicorn.

Alicia McCarthy and Ruby Neri / MATRIX 2.name: Alicia McCarthy and Ruby Neri / MATRIX 270
Alicia McCarthy and Ruby Neri / MATRIX 2.description: New work by two artists who got their start in San Francisco in the 1990s and have maintained a strong artistic dialogue ever since.

Master Traces, Transcultural Visions-BAM.name: Master Traces, Transcultural Visions
Master Traces, Transcultural Visions-BAM.description: Works dating from the second century through the twentieth reveal how Buddhist power was visually expressed and transmitted throughout Asia.

The 48th Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fi.name: The 48th Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fine Arts Graduate Exhibition
The 48th Annual UC Berkeley Master of Fi.description: This annual showcase celebrates the diverse and exceptional work of new graduates from the MFA program at Cal.

Al Wong: Lost Sister-BAMPFA.name: Al Wong: Lost Sister
Al Wong: Lost Sister-BAMPFA.description: Al Wong’s photocollage portraits of the sister he never met form a meditation on displacement and the collision between personal and geopolitical histories.

Cal Conversations: Dreaming the Lost Min.name: Cal Conversations: Dreaming the Lost Ming 夢回金陵
Cal Conversations: Dreaming the Lost Min.description: Created in collaboration with a UC Berkeley course, this exhibition explores the cataclysmic end of the Ming dynasty through paintings and literature of China’s long seventeenth century.

Agony in Effigy: Art, Truth, Pain, and t.name: Agony in Effigy: Art, Truth, Pain, and the Body
Agony in Effigy: Art, Truth, Pain, and t.description: This selection of historical works explores how physical violence and suffering have been represented in art, from the promise of transcendence to political critique.

Jay Heikes / MATRIX 269-BAMPFA.name: Jay Heikes / MATRIX 269
Jay Heikes / MATRIX 269-BAMPFA.description: Recent paintings, sculptures, and drawings that offer both a reflection on our cultural moment and a commitment to the material properties of the art object

Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Avant Dictee-BAMP.name: Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Avant Dictee
Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Avant Dictee-BAMP.description: View artworks and ephemera from the Cha archive at BAMPFA in dialogue with her best-known work, the artist's book Dictee.

Breaking ICE-BAMPFA.name: Breaking ICE
Breaking ICE-BAMPFA.description: A Community Response to a Citizenship Test

Way Bay-BAMPFA.name: Way Bay
Way Bay-BAMPFA.description: Explore the creative energies that have emerged from the Bay Area over the past two centuries with this sweeping array of art, film, performance, poetry, and archival materials.

Art Wall: Karabo Poppy Moletsane-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall: Karabo Poppy Moletsane
Art Wall: Karabo Poppy Moletsane-BAMPFA.description: Moletsane’s vibrant, large-scale portraits for the Art Wall draw on both traditional African visual culture and Afrofuturism.

On the Hour / Hayoun Kwon-BAMPFA.name: On the Hour / Hayoun Kwon
On the Hour / Hayoun Kwon-BAMPFA.description: I Suddenly Hear the Flap of Wings

Veronica De Jesus / MATRIX 268-BAMPFA.name: Veronica De Jesus / MATRIX 268
Veronica De Jesus / MATRIX 268-BAMPFA.description: De Jesus's memorial portraits honor artists, writers, and diverse cultural figures, testifying to the fact that each life is valuable and worthy of recognition.

Repentant Monk: Illusion and Disillusion.name: Repentant Monk: Illusion and Disillusion in the Art of Chen Hongshou
Repentant Monk: Illusion and Disillusion.description: Chen Hongshou is a major figure in Chinese art of the late Ming and early Qing dynasties. This exhibition explores his visually compelling work and his response to the turmoil of his times.

Global Lives Project-BAMPFA.description: This collaborative video project captures twenty-four hours in the lives of diverse individuals across the globe.

Buddhist Realms-BAMPFA.name: Buddhist Realms
Buddhist Realms-BAMPFA.description: Tibetan Buddhist paintings and sculptures vividly evoke the realms of the celestial and the supernatural.

Miyoko Ito / MATRIX 267-BAMPFA.name: Miyoko Ito / MATRIX 267
Miyoko Ito / MATRIX 267-BAMPFA.description: Discover the singular vision of a Berkeley-born artist whose paintings explore both exterior and interior landscapes.

Gordon Parks: The Making of an Argument-.description: This investigation of the editorial process behind Parks's photo-essay "Harlem Gang Leader" reveals unspoken conflicts between photographer, editor, subject, and truth.

Martin Wong: Human Instamatic-BAMPFA.description: This retrospective surveys the career of "one of our great urban visionaries" (New York Times), from Northern California to New York and back.

To the Letter: Regarding the Written Wo.description: This exhibition crosses cultures and centuries to bring together works that activate the expressive and aesthetic potential of letters and words.

Information in the Flesh: Art for Human.description: Works by Fernando Botero, Adrian Piper, and others demonstrate how power is articulated and reinforced through the dehumanized body.

Divine Visions, Earthly Pleasures: Five.description: Works from the BAMPFA collection reveal the richness and variety of India's painterly traditions.

Charles Howard: A Margin of Chaos-BAMPFA.description: Discover the enigmatic work of this pioneering yet underrecognized painter, who bridged figurative, Surrealist, and abstract currents in modern art.

The 47th Annual University of California.description: Works by this year's MFA recipients from UC Berkeley's Department of Art Practice.

Sam Contis / MATRIX 266-BAMPFA.description: Photographic works made at the remote and idiosyncratic Deep Springs College.

Irwin Kremen / MATRIX 265-BAMPFA.description: Exquisitely composed collages incorporating fragments of found, or "experienced," paper.

AMERICA AMERICA: Art for Human Rights-BA.description: Works from the collection examining the history of US human rights.

Erica Deeman: Silhouettes-BAMPFA.description: Large-scale photographs of women from the African diaspora, presented in a way that challenges traditional assumptions about artistic technique and individual identity.

Art Wall: Lawrence Weiner-BAMPFA.description: The artist continues his exploration of language as medium in this newly commissioned work.

Cecilia Edefalk / MATRIX 261-BAMPFA.description: Stockholm-based artist Cecilia Edefalk’s engagement with nature comes to the fore in this MATRIX exhibition featuring watercolors, photographs, sculptures, and paintings.

Will Brown / MATRIX 259-BAMPFA.description: Inspired by enigmatic stories about Dan Flavin’s 1978 site-specific installation at BAMPFA, Will Brown’s MATRIX exhibition includes installations outside BAMPFA’s Bancroft Way building, an artist book displayed in UC Berkeley’s Morrison Library, and a one-night theatrical production written by poet and playwright Kevin Killian.

The 45th Annual University of California.description: We are honored to present the work of six promising artists-Leslie Dreyer, Tanja Geis, Lee Lavy, Michelle Ott, Sofie Ramos, and Matt Smith Chavez-in the forty-fifth edition of the annual MFA exhibition. This year's presentation will be held at the Berkeley Art Center, 1257 Walnut Street, Berkeley.

Tarek Atoui / MATRIX 258-BAMPFA.name: Tarek Atoui / MATRIX 258
Tarek Atoui / MATRIX 258-BAMPFA.description: Electroacoustic musician Tarek Atoui uses custom-built electronic instruments and computers to create music as a powerful tool of expression and identity.

Art Wall / Tanya Agui\u00f1iga-BAMPFA.name: Art Wall / Tanya Aguiñiga
Art Wall / Tanya Agui\u00f1iga-BAMPFA.description: Tanya Aguiñiga creates sculptures and installations using natural materials and objects gathered from her environment. Her Art Wall installation at BAMPFA is her first solo presentation in the Bay Area. Aguiñiga presents a series of rust prints depicting a thirty-foot ladder made using an actual object that she found near the US–Mexico border.

MATRIX 286 / Amol K Patil: A Forest of R.name: MATRIX 286 / Amol K Patil: A Forest of Remembrance
MATRIX 286 / Amol K Patil: A Forest of R.description: Amol K Patil works across painting, sculpture, performance, and video and excavates the lived experiences of Mumbai’s working class. For his first solo exhibition in the United States, the artist presents a newly commissioned body of work that reconfigures the architecture of the city’s chawls into a space of collective memory and dynamic protest.

Art Wall / Tanya Agui\u00f1iga: Border F.name: Art Wall / Tanya Aguiñiga: Border Fall Height
Art Wall / Tanya Agui\u00f1iga: Border F.description: Tanya Aguiñiga creates sculptures and installations using natural materials and objects gathered from her environment. Her Art Wall installation at BAMPFA is her first solo presentation in the Bay Area. Aguiñiga presents a series of rust prints depicting a thirty-foot ladder made using an actual object that she found near the US–Mexico border.

Lee ShinJa: Drawing with Thread-BAMPFA.name: Lee ShinJa: Drawing with Thread
Lee ShinJa: Drawing with Thread-BAMPFA.description: Lee ShinJa: Drawing with Thread is the first North American survey of the work of the historically under-recognized Korean artist Lee ShinJa (b. 1930, Uljin, South Korea; lives and works in Seoul). Spanning more than five decades, from the 1950s to the early 2000s, the exhibition showcases the artist’s bold innovations in fiber through forty monumental textile works, woven maquettes, and preparatory sketches.

New Acquisition / Sky Hopinka: Sunflower.description: Sky Hopinka’s video Sunflower Siege Engine is a poetic meditation on history, resistance, and place.

Y(our) Legacy: Liberation for All of Us-.description: This exhibition of 'Y(our) Legacy' centers previous participants and a specific cohort of LGBTQ+ immigrants and refugees as we are currently witnessing the attack on LGBT communities made by Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin. Their description of artwork would consist of their self-reflection of what they feel about the current news impacting them and/or their community.

Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste F.name: Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste Future
Dalit Dreamlands: Toward An Anti-Caste F.description:
Asian American Women Artists Association (AAWAA), ARTogether, Discostan, and Oakland Asian Cultural Center co-presents “Dalit Dreamlands: Toward an Anti-Caste Future” – a landmark multimedia Dalit art exhibition and dance party that will bring together over 30 multiply marginalized artists from Dalit*, Adivasi*, Bahujan*, Afro-Indian, Indo-Caribbean, and Muslim communities to showcase the depths of creativity and community.
Dalit Dreamlands, curated by Manu Kaur (they/them) and supported through AAWAA’s Emerging Curator’s Program, will center queer and trans caste abolitionist futurisms through art across various mediums, including fashion design, music, performances, films, paintings and visuals. One of the headlining artists, Malvika Raj, is a Dalit artist who challenges the casteist restrictions present in the Madhubani style of painting, by incorporating pro-Dalit assertions into her intricate and hypnotizing designs. Nazrina Rodjan is a queer Indo-Surinamese artist who integrates the history of indentured labor and femme resilience within her large paintings of indentured Indian women.
London-based trans Dalit artist Mya Mehmi from Pxssy Palace will be one of four guest DJs and performers at the opening reception dance party in collaboration with Discostan’s Arshia Fatima Haq. Dalit Dreamlands is a historic event that marks one of the first queer Dalit-centered spaces to exist in California.
*Dalit is a caste marker for caste-oppressed communities formerly known as Untouchables, Adivasi refers to tribes who are indigenous to South Asia, and Bahujan is an umbrella term that includes all caste-oppressed communities.
 
CURATOR
Manu Kaur
EXHIBITING ARTISTS
Rinku Kumari, Jessie Sohpaul, Shivam Kamble, Nazrina Rodjan, Manpreet Singh, Malvika Raj, Seema Mattu, Mya Mehmi, Seema Hari, Shyama Kuver, Akhil Kang, Kaushik Tadvi, Rahee Punyashloka, Aravind Chedayan, Ajay Madhukar Dhoke, Shweta Ashokraj, Kamna Singh, Anika Nawar Ullah, Aindriya Barua, Ramnath Siddi, Siddi Tribe of Karnataka, Nrithya Pillai, Dalit Queer Project, Parth Pawar, Imaan Abbasi, Sri Vamsi Matta, R V Purusothaman (Purushu Arie), Shradha Raj, Jay Sagathia, Dee Chawla, Mia Kaur, Riri Kumbhar, Rohini bhadarge, John Spencer, Kulpreet Rana, & Simrah Farrukh
Event graphic by Parth Pawar.
